_header: The Mass it hath been used
_description: On the Mass — parts of two 6-line stanzas, aabccb

GULHun232.First Lines:
The masse it hathe bene vsydand never yet
                    refusyd…
GULHun232.Last Lines:
…then let vs be contentydAs our fathers were
                    before
GULHun232.Note:
Added by a later hand (fifteenth to sixteenth century) to left margin;
                    one stanza only (second occurrence in MS).
GULHun232.Editions:
Young,  John,  and  Patrick Henderson Aitken.  
             A Catalogue of the Manuscripts in the Library of the Hunterian
                Museum.
         Glasgow: James Maclehose, 1908: 185.
